verses.verse: Since we have these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God.
Accept us, we haven't wronged anyone; we haven't corrupted anyone; we haven't defrauded anyone.
I'm not saying this to condemn you, for I have said this before, that you are in our hearts to die and live with you.
[I've spoken] frankly about you, boasting about you. I am filled with comfort; I am exceedingly joyful in all our tribulation.
For when we had come to Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, and we were troubled on every side: outwardly confrontations, inwards fears.
Nevertheless, God, who comforts those who are cast down, comforted us by the coming of Titus.
Not only by his coming but by the comfort he had from you when he told us your earnest desire, your sorrow, your fervent mind toward me, so that I really rejoiced.
For even though I made you sad with the letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret, for I perceive that the same letter has made you sad--though only for a short time.
Now I rejoice, not that I made you sad, but that you were sad which lead to your repentance, for you were sad in a godly way, so that you might receive no loss from us in anything.
For godly sadness leads to repentance to a deliverance not to be regretted, but the sadness of the world leads to death.

For, look, concerning this very thing, you were sad in the godly sense [and] what earnestness it worked in you, indeed, it caused you to clear yourselves, indeed, what disgust, what fear, what longing, what zeal, what handing out of justice. In all this you have proved yourselves to be innocent in this matter.
Therefore, even though I wrote to you, not on account of the wrongdoer, nor on account of wronged, but instead that our care for you in God's sight might be obvious to you.
So then we were comforted at your comfort, yes and we rejoiced exceedingly at Titus' joy, because his spirit was refreshed by all of you.
For if I have bragged about anything to him, I am not ashamed, but like we talked to you about everything in truth, even so our bragging which I did to Titus is also true.
His deep care for you is very great as he reflects on your obedience; how with great respect and trembling did you welcome him.
Therefore I rejoice for the confidence I have in you in everything.
